item.title: [MCHECKSTYLE-193] Resource files get included regardless of explicit sourceDirectory / includes / excludes configuration
item.project: Maven Checkstyle Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description: Resource files get included into checkstyle audit regardless of explicit sourceDirectory / includes / excludes configuration, which seems wrong to me. I found no way of forcing version 2.10 to revert to the behavior of version 2.9.1 with regards to project resources.
item.summary: Resource files get included regardless of explicit sourceDirectory / includes / excludes configuration

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

Hi,

This is because of MCHECKSTYLE-184, which is a new feature in maven-checkstyle-plugin.

New features are nice and all but as long as they do not break existing builds. At the very least there should be a way to disable them.

Oleg

Hi,

Can you share your Checkstyle and Checkstyle plugin configuration with us? It should be possible to make this work.

I agree with Oleg.

If the behaviour of a plugin changes in an incompatible way, this should be very clearly documented in the release notes and announcement. The new feature in 2.10 which causes the problem was listed as:

MCHECKSTYLE-184 Allow src/main/resources to be searched by Checkstyle

However this gives no clue that the resources are additionally searched even if this was not requested.
The description implies it is an optional extra - which is what was in fact requested by the person who raised the JIRA - but it is not optional. Or if it is optional, the user should have to request the additional search - not be forced to amend their configuration to disable it.

I am not disagreeing with Oleg. I'm simply trying to see if I find out what is going wrong and help him fix that.

As I am the one who requested and implemented MCHECKSTYLE-184, I think I know what I requested. During my tests, the new feature should be "silent", i.e. should not affect a project unless it uses very specific Checkstyle rules, or have special configuration for maven-checkstyle-plugin.

I have plans to make this more configuratble in the future, but until people have tried it out it is be difficult to know what kind of configurations are wanted.

Check style can be found here [1] and plugin config can be found here [2]

Oleg

[1] https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/httpcomponents/hc-stylecheck/trunk/src/main/resources/hc-stylecheck/
[2] https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/httpcomponents/project/trunk/pom.xml

I've just committed a set of options:

includeResources
includeTestResources
resourceIncludes
resourceExcludes

Since 2.10 has been out there with the default of checking resources for some time now, I did not change the defaults.
Fixed in 1540550.
